alert.note: Alert for St. Clair (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 1:53PM CDT until March 31 at 2:30PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL ST. CLAIR COUNTY... At 152 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles west of Osceola, or 12 miles northeast of El Dorado Springs, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Truman Lake, Osceola, Lowry City, Roscoe, Vista, Tiffin, Taberville, Iconium, Monegaw Springs and Harper. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
